{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3542961,"name":"Eren Orhun","username":"erenorhun","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erenorhun/{size}/203650_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T22:05:18.392Z","cooked":"

we have a belt driven continuous elevator that has been working without a problem until a few hours ago. all of a sudden, our elevator started tickling and stopped going up. we tried to solve the problem ( and still couldn‚Äôt find the reason) and we realized that whenever we tilted our elevator/robot more than 45 degrees, it was working as it was before. after a few cycles it malfunctioned again. all the spools and belts are fine and in place. belts may be a little loose but i don‚Äôt think its the problem.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-27T22:05:18.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":28,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":175.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493548,"topic_slug":"elevator-ticking-problem","display_username":"Eren Orhun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55838,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/elevator-ticking-problem/493548/1","custom_user_title":"Excessive Loctite Enjoyer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3542965,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T22:10:49.459Z","cooked":"

There is not enough tension on the system. Belts can experience creep and slowly creep over time, which cause cause it to get loose, depending on what they are made of. (Kevlar creeps at room temperature, steel, fiberglass, and carbon for the most part don‚Äôt, idk about neoprene).

How much belt wrap do you have on the drive pulleys? You could benefit from increasing it significantly.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-27T22:10:49.459Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493548,"topic_slug":"elevator-ticking-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/elevator-ticking-problem/493548/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3542969,"name":"Eren Orhun","username":"erenorhun","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erenorhun/{size}/203650_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T22:16:27.814Z","cooked":"

as far as i understand from ‚Äúbelt wrap on drive pulleys‚Äù we have only one layer of belt on the drive pulley. Our system in based on 4414‚Äôs 2023 elevator. even the tensioner (we didn‚Äôt tried to use it by the way)

I don‚Äôt mean layers of belt, like now many degrees of the pulle has teeth engaged.

erenorhun:

even the tensioner (we didn‚Äôt tried to use it by the way)

I‚Äôd probably use it then.

I checked the spool as you said, there were no teeth skipping or a problem like that. i tensioned the belt and it was working fine at first but it malfunctioned again after a few cycles

Have you identified the source of the ticking? If the belts aren‚Äôt slipping, a likely cause to check is the breaker for that circuit tripping repeatedly.

the ticking stopped after we tried to replace the motor. we tried to find if it was motor‚Äôs problem of spark max‚Äôs. turns out our electrical had a fault and every spark max we tried made that motor do the ticking. its working smoothly since then
